author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: A Closeted Past, Partially Recaptured
text:
Is it possible to write too well? At times the novels of Alan Hollinghurst seem to test this proposition. Take, for starters, just one sentence plucked from many of its kind in the British author’s latest, “The Sparsholt Affair” (Knopf, 417 pages $28.95): “At nine, the daylight was fading in the attic room, and the moon, full, or one night shy of fullness, hung above the parapet and looked in, mild but implacable, over Ivan’s table, his diary, the bundles of letters and cuttings, the rare Oxford photo of the Brasenose First Eight, Michaelmas Term 1940.”
There...
